page.title: 19LOCAL HISTORY W.READING
page.content: {INDUSTRY}Brickmaking was carried out for centuries,the clay being dug from the hills above the River Kennet. "TILEHURST".Three brick kilns existed at Coley/Katesgrove and Tilehurst they specialised in the production of terracotta bricks many of which can be seen in local victorian buildings.The last working kiln was demolished in 1970.A kiln and chimney still stands off Honey End Lane as a monument to this industry.{TRANSPORT.} During the 18th century the river kennet was the main transport link between Reading and Newbury.A canal was added and opened in 1723,but the prosperity of the waterway ceased with the opening of the Railway networks throughout the 19th century.{READING {ABBEY,}built 1121 was demolished by Henry V111 and is now ruined. {
